title: Academia AI student dashboard with planner, assistant, roadmap, focus tracker, and settings

requirements.text: Implement a cohesive modern SaaS-style UI in dark mode by default with a premium, minimal look (rounded cards, soft shadows, subtle gradient accents, smooth hover/transition effects, clean typography) and ensure full responsiveness including a collapsible mobile sidebar.

acceptanceCriteria: App loads in dark mode by default.
Sidebar collapses into a mobile-friendly navigation pattern on small screens.
Core UI elements (cards, buttons, inputs) consistently use rounded corners, soft shadows, and smooth transitions.
Do not use a blue/purple primary palette; choose a distinct dark premium palette and apply consistently.

requirements.text: Add a "Syllabus text to plan" input in Study Planner that generates a structured daily breakdown into study tasks; because external LLM APIs are not supported, implement a deterministic local planner (rule-based chunking) that produces daily tasks from the provided syllabus text and deadline range, and clearly label it as an automated planner.

acceptanceCriteria: User can paste syllabus text and choose/confirm a deadline range; app generates a multi-day task plan without calling external AI services.

requirements.text: Enforce plan-based assistant usage limits: Free plan allows 10 assistant queries per day per user; Pro plan is unlimited; show an upgrade popup once the free limit is reached and block additional queries until the next day or until plan is upgraded.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes typed endpoints to create/read/update/delete study tasks and to append/read chat history and focus sessions.
All reads/writes are authorized by caller principal; users cannot access others‚Äô data.
User profile and plan are persisted and retrievable for the authenticated caller.

requirements.text: Add production-quality UX states across the app: loading indicators for data fetches, error handling for failed operations, and toast notifications for key actions (save, create task, completed session, quota reached).

quotes:
Error handling
Loading states
Toast notifications

acceptanceCriteria: All major async operations show a loading state and handle errors without crashing the page.
Successful creates/updates show a toast confirmation; failures show an error toast/message.
Quota reached shows a blocking upgrade modal/popup on assistant interactions.

constraints: Use the pre-injected React + TypeScript frontend (Tailwind, shadcn/ui composition, React Query) and Motoko single-actor backend; do not introduce Next.js, Supabase, or external databases.

Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything in frontend/src/components/ui; compose these components instead.
All backend logic must live in a single Motoko actor (per platform architecture).
Do not integrate external LLM providers (e.g., OpenAI/Anthropic) or any other unsupported third-party auth; use Internet Identity for authentication.
nonGoals: Calling the OpenAI API or any external AI service; assistant/plan generation must be local/deterministic.
Real-time messaging, push notifications, email/SMS notifications, or WebSocket-based features.
Payment processing for upgrades/subscriptions (only display and plan state/quota behavior as specified).
